page.title: 10Popular activities, Swindon.
page.content: My computer is a Sinclair Spectrum 48K which cost Â£120. I spend an hour on it every day, organising things like my stamp collection, playing games and learning French. Many families have a computer of some sort today. The Spectrum is popular because it is quite powerful, can do many things and is good value. It is made by the inventer Sir Clive Sinclair who revolutionised British computer electronics in the 1980's. { My favourite game is draughts. It is played on a board with 64 black and white squares. Two players have 12 counters (men) each. The men can only move forwards to the other side of the board to become Kings. A man is taken when jumped.The loser has no men left.
